medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral congenital cataracts and corneal abnormalities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, an 81-year-old man, has a history of bilateral congenital cataract extraction as a teenager. He has experienced a gradual decrease in visual acuity in the left eye over several years prior to presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of posterior polymorphous dystrophy and well-controlled arterial hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: The family history includes multiple members across several generations with congenital cataracts and corneal abnormalities.
